Also ordered the Gulab jamun dessert which was ok. I've had way better elsewhere. 

The chai tea was the most disappointing as I was really looking forward to tasting the cardamom and ginger flavours of india. 

Finally, I tried an order of plain butter naan and garlic naan which were tasty on their own. 

I realize this is at a food court so expectations need to be kept low.

After Misti Y.'s Hall Monitor CMYE, a few of us decided to walk across to the Riviera for some India Masala action. Its location is kinda odd being part of a food court than a free standing restaurant.

Their menu is pretty extensive, offering curries, dosas, and vegetarian items as well. I split the Tandoori grill Combo with the wifey and the portions were pretty generous, but the price ($15) was pretty steep for a food court entree

Taste is everything and every bite was delicious as was the naan and chutneys that came with our order. we don't frequent Indian dining spots as much (because my stomach is craving Goyemon most of the time)
but I'd like to return to try their other items...ALOHA!!!

YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(15/365) "Namaste!"

Not bad for fast food. 

Inside the fashion show mall, this was a bit pricey at $12.99 for a chicken tikka masala, but the dish was a good size and the naan was big and fresh, and of course, it's Vegas!

The chicken was a bit tough/overcooked but the sauce was ok. The naan was definitely my favorite.

Horrible place!
We ordered 2 non veg thali and waited for abt 15 mins only to get 2 freaking veg thalis. The cashier said he heard veg thalis. Idk how he heard that coz  we were 6 ppl and one of my friends was ordering the food and we all heard him saying non veg. Coz none of us like only veggie. There was a hispanic looking guy who came and asked to pay $4 more for 2 extra plates of chicken and we did so. I would have still given this place a 3 star rating inspite of the bad argument we had. But rice was horrible. Idk why they cant afford a good basmati rice. Never had such worse rice in my life. And what would i do with my chicken tikka masala without rice.? We all were so pissed. That one star is for staying open 24 hrs.

Last month we visited this place for the lunch time and they have buffet going on. We just tried their buffet and everything was really good.
They have something with medu vada with yogurt and it's really good.

For a food court on the Vegas strip the food was really good. I had the chicken biryani which was really good and the price was no bad @ 10.95.

They also have several thalis which come with a nan, rice and 3 types of curry which was good. really enjoy eating some Indian food right on the strip.
Very impressed with the high quality indian food at a food court. I ordered the chicken tikka masala and nan, so good!! I am indian and approve :)

Amazing taste. Yummy paneer butter masala and butter chicken. You must try it.
This like a home for me now as I am in town for business every two months.

Real Indian taste.

Try it once!!! You might make a trip to Vegas just to eat here. If you are a foodie.

Parijat Hande
From Pune India
Had a gr8 experience! Sarav was really nice ! We had dinner on feb 10th 2016 & went back coz of Sarv & had brunch before heading back to L.A .

I took the suggestions and had the dosa masala. I also added some vegetable pakoras, and they were all very good.  Very tasty, well prepared, very much worth the price. 

I like to judge ethnic food by how many people of that ethnicity are actually present at the restaurant when I am there eating.  Its safe to say that the Indian community is well aware of India Masala and are pleased with the food that is presented there.  That to me, is a sign of a winner.

The Good:
Open 24 hours.
Dosa tastes well.
Food is ready in less than 10 minutes.

The bad:
Other items such as Chana Masala or Chilli Panner tastes bad. 

Always order something that can be prepared fast like dosa.

We came here once, while on a five day vacation to Vegas, and we just continued to come here for almost all meals. I loved the vegetarian thali, chole bhaturas, chicken biryani, seekh kababs. Sweet lassi and mango lassi are not that great. But chai is good. Prices are decent as compared to what you have to pay for everything at Vegas. Location is also great as the fashion mall is quite close to all hotels at the strip! For a fast food place, it really was above our expectations.

Great indian food at Fashion show mall.Awesome taste  and authentic indian food
Had Chole Batura/idli/chicken curry/chicken chetinad/mutton biryani

All above items were 5* except biryani would be 3.5*
Not to mention their Tea , it was nice
Very good indian food. Specially Dal Maharani, mutter paneer and chai. I liked naan and biryani as well.
I'm not a big fan of the Indian food been since I eat in that place I absolutely love it that's the only Indian food  place that I really love

I don't normally come to a mall to enjoy good food, but the Fashion Show Mall finally has quality food in their food court! Every mall has a Panda Express as their "ethnic" food, but for once another culture is represented. 

My friend usually orders my Indian food for me, but since I was alone I didn't know what to order. Monica was really nice and let me try 3 of their top curry sauces. I ended up ordering the palak paneer because it was the lightest in taste; it wasn't too spicy but has the perfect amount of flavor. 

Palak paneer is a vegetarian Indian dish consisting of spinach, tomato gravy sauce and paneer in a thick paste made from puréed spinach and seasoned with garlic, garam masala, and other spices. My dish came with firm tofu pieces, rice, and a HUGE naan. 

Overall: the food was delicious, the portion was fair and worth the $11.99, and the customer service was great!
Excellent . They have a wide selection for the lunch buffet and include a drink.. also they make fresh naan and dosa to order .. it's excellent

Worst food I have ever had. Ridiculous, horrible food we went because of the reviews we read in yelp we will never return there even if we were starving or may be you can say dying for indian food. Never in my life again. Big black spot on vegas , indian and punjabi taste. I think they serve much better food in indian jails then this place. Horrible and nasty food joint.

Very good vegan options if you're looking for a quick bite while shopping. Their aloo gobi is the best and most flavorful I've had. Lots of onions and spices! They have one soup which is very nice and somewhat spicy as well.
Delicious Indian food that you get instantly, no wait. Try everything here it's all amazing. Masala Dosa with buttermilk is delicious

Wow. Very surprised. Simple and flavorful - real Indian food. Even my parents liked it and they are hardly ever happy with takeout Indian. Even the lassi wasn't too sweet. Better than the Indian restaurants we tried too.

There aren't that many highly rated Indian restaurant on the strip (so it seems - please message me if am wrong) so we went for what, according to other yelpers, was above average. First, it turns out that this place is inside a mall and is part of the food court ensemble. This is not obvious from the address. Nevertheless, we waited to be delighted by some savory Indian food but left with a rather mixed score. I ordered the vegetarian thali which is served with three side dishes, yogurt, pickle, rice, and a naan. 
Let's start with the good. The naan was really thin, crisp and yummy. A perfectly charred creation from the clay oven. Yogurt raita was fine as well. Mango lassi was simply marvelous. The three dishes - Chick peas, Saag, and Lentils - were surprisingly sub-par. For one, they were served a bit cold. Second the saag and chick peas just didn't have any zest and tasted very "formulaic" with no character. None of the flavors really stood out. Almost as if the cook's heart was not it. 
Serving was quick - it's after all inside a mall's food court.  We just wanted something within walking distance this time but will dig deeper for good Indian food on the next trip.

I was starting to crave some Indian food and I walked up to the counter to read the menu items. After standing at the register for a solid 3 minutes, the young man at the register never offered to answer any questions or even acknowledge me. I asked him what size cup is available for the mango lassi, and his apathetic answer was "About a 12 ounce?" ... I pointed at the soft drink cups and said "so roughly that size?" and he only goes "yeah something like that"

It would've. Just been easier to grab a cup for your lassi and show me? He was too busy on his cell phone, though.
Tasty food but seemed a bit pricey given the bad ambience. Good thing about it- open 24/7.Worth a try!

My first time to  this outlet and I must say it was really a pleasant experience. Strolling down the mall, on business, lunch time in the foodcourt was India Masala. 

A clean tidy Indian fast food operation, with a pretty extensive menu to suit all Indian style taste buds. We tried the Masala Dosa (this is the second time in this week for me) - and my friend order the same too.

Very good quality, at an inexpensive price, the dosa was crisp and filling was true to the Indian flavor, accompanied by sambar and chutneys - both very good. 

I strongly recommend visiting India Masala, foodcourt when you are there. Its probably the best food in that foodcourt, all other outlets look really tried 

Good work

Hands down the best Indian food I had in Vegas. only down side is, its in a food court and most times, I had to wait 10 mins minimum to get my food. if you like Tandoori, Tandoori Combo gives a small portion of different tandoori dish (Caution: Longer wait time for this dish) my favorite. 

I have tried chicken biriyani, butter chicken combo, utthapam and Tandoori combo. This is a north Indian style kitchen and expecting south Indian dishes like uthappam to be good is my mistake. Biriyani was decent, Butter chicken melted in my mouth. There was a girl on the cash register was explaining that her favorite drink is Mango lassi to one of the person ahead of me in the line, so I wanted to try it out, it turned out to be the best of all Mango lassi I had.

Naan was soft and yummy.  $15.99 for Tandoori Combo may be little pricy, but better than most Indian lunch buffet I had in Vegas.

I learned that they have another restaurant near the strip where they have buffet (India Masala Bar & Grill - 1040 E Flamingo Rd Las Vegas, NV 89119) and more like proper restaurant. I am going to try it the next time when I will be in Vegas.

This joint is located in Riviera Hotel's food mall, you can park for free at Riviera self parking at the rear of the Riviera casino.

Bottom line: Nice little joint for good tasty North Indian food.
The food is not great, but good for a one time snack. We got the Veg thali, Chole bhatura, Nan and Sabzi, Gulab jamun and chai. The quantity was okay, less than most Indian restaurants. Overall, meh!

Very unhygienic place to eat!!
open 24 hrs 
we went with friends ordered naan ,dosa ,Malai kofta etc.,
Dosa is tasteless!! 
Food tastes real bad at this place .But i see most of the Indians eating here.


I would prefer going to India masala on E flamingo st.
That is definitely a must try if you want Indian food!!

Located in the Riveria, all the way in the back in the food court, in a tiny corner and its open 24 hours. Limited late night menu after 10:30pm, and breakfast 5am till 10am.

Prices range from about $11 and up per dish. So by food court standards its expensive. I ordered 2 dishes and the guy wanted to make sure someone was eating with me, since it was a lot if food. Lol...do I look like I can eat all that? Even if I was going to eat it all, it was none of his business. 

I ordered chicken Tikka and it was sprinkled in some kind of curry powder and was very dry. The meat was red on the outside,  like tandori chicken usually is. Not the chicken tikka Im used too. Wasnt the best. I also ordered the chicken tikka Masala with was 75% sauce 25% chicken, served with equal parts of white rice.

I have access to really good Indian food in the OC and I am not a fan of this food. And I was left hungry and disappointed. The beast, however enjoyed his meal and has a tradition of coming here  every year when hes in town.

Im not a fan, but others dig it. 2.5 stars rounding up to 3. Be prepared to eat on Styrofoam plates and plastic utensils.
Food was great! This place is inside the fashion show mall. Way better than the hotel's food I stayed in.

This place has great food, absolutely delicious and authentic Indian cuisine.  This is real food and not the typical fast food you find in the mall.  I was surprised that the food quality and taste is fantastic for being in the mall food court.  My favorite is the tandoori chicken, butter chicken, and mango lassi drink.
Mediocre Indian Food. Good Quantity, poor quality.

I was pleasantly surprised!  After a long morning of shopping, we started getting hungry.  The other restaurants in the food court seemed questionable and so we decided to take a chance here and I'm happy we did.  The butter chicken curry was DELiCIoUS.  Perfectly seasoned with just the right consistency, it was actually better than a lot of the other Indian restaurants I've been too!  
The naan and rice were a great complement to the curry and it left me wanting more.  I'll be back.
The food is average..Malai paneer and Malai kofta is good..  i would recommend it to check out once.
Food is awesome, but the service is really bad,i ask for water she gave me water cup and told me to filled out from around the corner from water tap that was not really nice
Great food. They even serve an Uttappam, a rare dish to see in Indian restaurants. Open 24 hrs. Service is quick and food is simply great. Lot of space around to enjoy your food.
Great food . Best environment . I wish I should have gone the few time but never mind. It's always another time.
We loved this little hole in the wall!!! YUM chicken tika masala.
Un des meilleur poulet au buerre que j'ai mangé. Les enfants on trippé sur la nouriture. un service merveilleux

This is located inside Rivera hotel. Its one of the best food to have. Lots of menu.
They server South and North Indian dishes. They do make yummy dosa's .
They do have lot of seating arrangement though its inside the casino. Served with care.

This is one of Fashion Show mall's food court shacks, I admit that I went in with low expectations, thinking that a food court restaurant will probably not offer typical Indian food. I was wrong, there Chicken Masala in on par with any good Indian restaurant. The Tandoori bread was also fresh and authentic. Their menu offer other classics, kabob and such. I would come back try the rest.

I had been going to this place for some times now.  They used be in food court of Reviera Hotels and Casino on South Las Vegas Blvd aka The Strip.  Now they have relocated to The Fashion Island... But the teast and service remains same.  

I had ordered Butter Paneer Masala with rice and naan... It was delicious! My wife and dad had Dosa...and my daughter had Chole Bhatuda... ALL GONE!  Their Chicken is also excellent.  

However, they can improve their Chicken 65 dish... it was little too dry...The best Chicken 65 I had was in Atlanta (next to The Patel Brothers...there is Indo-Chinese Fusion place).

None of less, the service and staff are very friendly and excellent.  One major improvement is now they have eBuzzer... so when your order is ready...the assigned buzzer  goes off... they dont scream/yell your name in speaker when your order is ready! 

India Masala...you will always be my GoTo place....

Thanks
Cheers!

Great Indian food! I had the Tikka Masala very spicy and it delivered (obviously it's a British dish).  The naan was good too. Hot and soft and the bottom was crispy.  The people working were very nice too.

A couple of weeks ago my husband and I went to a festival celebrating Indian culture and food at the county building. While there, we sampled food from several Indian restaurants around town, and were most pleased with what we had at the booth of India Masala, which is permanently located in the Riviera. For the first time we had dosa, a lentil and rice pancake/crepe that is a typical dish of Southern India. We happened to pick up a postcard offering 25% off our check so we decided to head to the Riviera to see what else was being offered.

It's no surprise that the Riviera is on its last legs, and ranks up there with Circus Circus as being the most rundown hotel on the strip. We certainly worked up an appetite as we made the looooong walk from the parking garage to the food court (next time I'd valet in the front of the casino). No, we weren't expecting Indian Masala to be a semi-fast food restaurant, but as it turns out, it was. The prices aren't really justified considering this, but the food is really good and it was packed with more Indians and convention attendees than any other tenant's space when we were there (see below), so we figured it was safe to stay. We had to wait about in line for five minutes and then another ten minutes or so for our food, which was a bit frustrating, but I felt rewarded when I got my dosa. Today I opted for one stuffed with spinach, the palak dosa ($7.99), but you can also choose from a filling of chickpeas (chole), potatoes (masala), or no filling at all (plain). It is served with what I learned to be the traditional accompaniments, sambar (a vegetable soup) and coconut chutney (imagine a thick and textured almond milk). There is also a third side that I can best describe as a pureed and spiced red bell pepper spread. The dosa is flavorful enough on its own, but the sauces add another dimension and were very much enjoyed. The dosa itself is delicate, with a browned, crisp exterior and a soft, lightly chewy interior. You can get a better idea of the textural difference when you order it plain, but the filling makes it a meal. I must say it's a dish that's growing on me, and I'd bear the pain of walking through that casino to enjoy another one day. My husband was less thrilled with his dish, but it seems to me that the emphasis here is on lesser known Southern Indian cuisine so chicken vindaloo ($11.99) might not have been the best option. This vindaloo was flavorful but not nearly hot enough for Ian who asked them to make it as spicy as possible. The larger problem was the color of the sauce, which was reminiscent of an artificially colored sweet and sour. The color should have been deeper and darker had it been a result of the spices. Things that don't look natural probably aren't, so we'll just say this color most likely wasn't derived from where it should have been.

If you are interested in trying a new kind of Indian dish that isn't available at other restaurants around town (as far as I know), I would definitely recommend coming here for the dosa. I'd be willing to try a few other things but I think what I had was the most reasonably priced for you what you get, and certainly the most unique.
